titleStmt.title: A continued iournall of all the proceedings of the Duke of Buckingham his Grace, on the Isle of Ree, a part of France, from the beginning vntill this 17. of August In whom are combined religion, fortitude, and clemencie; being the true characters of a noble generall. Published by authoritie.

editionStmt.edition: This text is an enriched version of the TCP digital transcription A14422 of text S111523 in the English Short Title Catalog (STC 24741). Textual changes and metadata enrichments aim at making the text more computationally tractable, easier to read, and suitable for network-based collaborative curation by amateur and professional end users from many walks of life. The text has been tokenized and linguistically annotated with MorphAdorner. The annotation includes standard spellings that support the display of a text in a standardized format that preserves archaic forms ('loveth', 'seekest'). Textual changes aim at restoring the text the author or stationer meant to publish.

respStmt.resp: This text has not been fully proofread

fileDesc.extent: Approx. 34 KB of XML-encoded text transcribed from 13 1-bit group-IV TIFF page images.

publicationStmt.pubPlace: Evanston,IL, Notre Dame, IN, St. Louis, MO

availability.p: This keyboarded and encoded edition of the work described above is co-owned by the institutions providing financial support to the Early English Books Online Text Creation Partnership. This Phase I text is available for reuse, according to the terms of Creative Commons 0 1.0 Universal . The text can be copied, modified, distributed and performed, even for commercial purposes, all without asking permission.

titleStmt.title: A continued iournall of all the proceedings of the Duke of Buckingham his Grace, on the Isle of Ree, a part of France, from the beginning vntill this 17. of August In whom are combined religion, fortitude, and clemencie; being the true characters of a noble generall. Published by authoritie.
titleStmt.author: Garetson, Mr.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed [by Augustine Mathewes] for Thomas Walkley, and are to be sold at his shop at the Eagle and Childe in Britaines-Bursse,

notesStmt.note: Includes: Receiued at Yorke-House. August 15. A relation of Mr. Garetson, master of the shippe called the Bread and Beere-pott of Horne in Holland ..
The last leaf contains two woodcuts of ships.
Variant: title page omits "from the beginning vntill this 17. of August".
Reproduction of a photostat of the original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.
